ja67:1.1: A distressed woman is forced to choose between son, husband, and brother. They choose their brother, as the others may be readily replaced. | _Ucchaṅge_ (“lap”) here is a sexual innuendo; the commentary likens it to a “bag” in which vegetables are kept.
ja67:1.2: She can pick up a husband on the street as easily as she can conceive a son in her “lap”.
